Body: Cooling Baths for TerraMiner's Second Farm in the Making!  We're happy to address everyone following the TerraMiner project. Here's great news: the second farm is under construction! Right now the cooling baths for our submersive cooling systems are being assembled. We also expect the first batch of ASIC miners to arrive any moment now, and as soon as they do, we begin setting them up and running tests.  The cooling system for the second farm will be different from the first generation MMU: this time the heat exchange unit will have a cold water circuit utilizing artesian well water at 8-10°C. The water will transfer the heat away down into the same well. This solution allows to cool down the heat transfer agent inside the baths more efficiently without much extra expenses.  You still have some time before the end of Post-ICO to buy TRM2 tokens and become the owner of a share in our farm's hashpower. Each TRM2 token is backed by 1Mh/sec of Scrypt algorithm mining hashpower. The revenue from mining is equally split between token holders and the company.  As opposed to cloud mining, with TerraMiner you don't just rent, but own the hashpower, which means you can sell the tokens on an exchange. Besides, every three months we buy more hardware with 10% of mining revenue to offset the rise in network difficulty.  Don't miss out on TRM2 tokens – the bonus goes down every three days!

Title: [ANN][ICO]TerraMiner - The First mining farm in which anyone can invest.
Body: Our investors may know that TerraMiner is no longer using Nicehash as our payment service, and last week we began migrating to our own pool that is also designed to be switching between the most profitable Scrypt coins at any given moment, depending on the network parameters and currency rates. The coins mined are then sent to an exchange and swapped for ETH to be distributed between token holders. Today we are happy to announce that 100% of TerraMiner hashpower was moved to our own pool! We congratulate our investors on this step, and remind them how our new system works: now all payments are sent in ETH to investors’ wallets automatically (through a smart contract). Payouts will be done daily (subject to a minimum threshold of $50 worth). This also allows us to increase security as the company would not store funds and does not allow interactions with the wallet through the website. So even in the event where the website security gets compromised, hackers won't be able to steal investors’ profits. We also want to point out that all the funds that haven’t been withdrawn will be swapped and paid out in ETH. You can track the pool’s statistics at https://terrahash.online/

Body: Dear investors, verification is crucial to identify the true owners of token addresses.  Unfortunately, we ran into unexpected issues – as you know, the Ethereum blockchain is an open ledger, and all the TRM1 transactions are open source, which was taken advantage of by some sneaky characters. The dashboard on our website does not allow you to link one MEW to two different accounts, and so they went through the extensive list of TRM1 token holder addresses available on etherscan and similar block explorers and found the unclaimed addresses containing tokens. These addresses include exchange wallets, custodial wallets like coinbase and others that do not allow regular users to interact with the ERC20 tokens inside. This issue was caused by users’ sending Ethereum directly to our smart contract during the first ICO while not having the private key to the payment source address. We made the mistake of letting that slide and resending the tokens to such users as a new transaction, effectively issuing tokens twice. This left the network with quite a few extra tokens that we considered unusable until now, but as it turns out, some people managed to scope these addresses out, register new accounts and link the extra tokens, eating away at the other investors’ share of profits. Luckily, when this issue began manifesting itself, we locked down withdrawals and no coins were withdrawn by people who don’t deserve them.  To put an end to this issue we ask you to undergo a simple process of verification that will prove your ownership of the private key associated to the MEW address your account is linked to. It consists of one step – send 0.00000001 TRM from your MEW address to:  0x20C5D0a35cC469A10D48Fc92d0fc0C6a6ee490E1 Just by sending the miniscule fraction of a token you will prove your full ownership of the MEW address.  After we weed out all the extra tokens from the system, the profits will be recalculated and result in a slight increase in our investors’ profits!  We are sorry for the inconvenience, but completing this procedure is crucial to all of us. Please undergo verification before 25 January 2018. The profit withdrawal will come back on after we recalculate profits on 26 January to only accommodate verified addresses.

Body: Hello to all TerraMiner project participants! This post will cover the bounty campaign held during the first ICO. We get a lot of questions about our bounty rewards, and we’ll do our best to clear this up. Bounty campaign token allocation was set at 1% of the total amount of tokens sold, which is 1 480 TRM (total sold: 148 000 TRM). Every week during pre-ICO, ICO and post-ICO, bounty campaign participants were awarded a different number of stakes for their actions on social media. The total amount of bounty tokens was divided into sections, for example, Twitter was allocated 20%, which is 296 TRM. 524 Twitter users were awarded 7 995 stakes, therefore, 10 stakes would earn a user 0,37 TRM. Other social media platforms had the same mechanism. Bounty calculation and payment were done automatically, and after the campaign ended, its participants received their bonus tokens. That’s when we started receiving complaints about the low bonus payments, and we decided to recalculate the results. It took quite sometime, but here we are: the results came out just the same. From the mathematical standpoint, bounty rewards are 100% correct. What we didn’t take into account, however, was the human factor, we couldn’t track this issue down with this many participants, many of whom turned out to have a big percentage of bots among their followers. Unfortunately, we can’t find out the full scale of this fraud. Right now we’re developing new bounty campaign terms for the second ICO that we’re holding this December. We will contact real experts in the field and use algorithms that will allow us to eliminate cheaters and reward honest bloggers who believe in the project. Author: terraminer_io
Title: [ANN][ICO]TerraMiner - The First mining farm in which anyone can invest.
Body: Dear investors! Yesterday Pavel Kuznetsov held a webinar where he told about his business trip to China and our current state of affairs. Here’s a summary for our English-speaking investors.  ✔New farm location “We decided to relocate the farm away from the hydro power plant closer to the city so that we could tap into either the hydro plant supply, or the city energy supply, which is important to avoid downtime: small hydro power plants in China don’t work year round. When the power plant is undergoing maintenance we will power the farm from the local power grid. This will cut farm downtime to mere 2 days a month on average. All the hardware will be mounted in a branded container making a convenient and mobile solution. The container itself is being prepared for hardware installation. We have concluded the rental contract with the site owner. We’re not the only mining projects on that site too, which makes it particularly special. We’ve been looking for such a place for a long time, comparing different options, and this one hits home just right. If you remember, I left Guangzhou on a quick notice, that was for negotiations with the landlord. We’re granted the space, public utilities, and an engineer to help our own engineering team with the hardware. This site also allows us to scale up our project and install as many containers as we need.”  ✔ INNOSILICON contract. Why not Bitmain? “Bitmain doesn’t sell chips separately, they only have ready-made solutions, and that’s not what we need. INNOSILICON agreed to sell us chips only. I’m also their partner on projects other than TerraMiner. We’re already receiving hardware for our other projects, that’s why we put our trust in that supplier. We visited their HQ in Wuhan and our negotiations went well into the night until almost 2 AM. The main point of negotiations was our request for them to install chips into hashboards by themselves, so that if something went wrong, we’d be able to troubleshoot quicker and eliminate the risk of our own mistakes during hardware assembly and installation. They did not take that too well initially, but gave in and agreed to make an exception for our company. Why did we decide to change our plans and order hardware assembly at INNOSILICON? Should we assemble the hardware ourselves, we won’t have the right for warranty, which is annulled in the case of a third party assembling the hashboards. That’s why we decided to assemble the first batch with the help of the manufacturer and avoid unnecessary problems. We’re likely to order our second batch assembly somewhere else, however.”   ✔ Mineral oil cooling technology “We don’t make our own cooling baths, and order them from a third company, from our own blueprint instead. We’ve already ordered and paid for them. Their manufacture takes 2 weeks and another 10 days for delivery. They arrive on 15 December, and the manufacturers are responsible for their installation as well. Baths are warranty-protected as well. For the first TerraMiner farm we placed our bets on hardware and cooling baths warranty, concluded agreements to guarantee uninterruptible power supply and keep downtime to a minimum. We could’ve assembled it all ourselves, and lose warranty because of it. Considering how one bath contains dozens of hashboards, any unscheduled repairs or failures would put almost a third of out farm’s capacity out of operation. That’s why we went the longer and more expensive route this time, which is more reliable in return – full warranty for all hardware and installation.” How does one get started in this game he knows nothing about? “Our project is just for you. You don’t have to buy a miner for $1000-$5000. Buy some tokens for as much as you want and enjoy minimal risks. You’ll see how it works. You just buy hashrate, the rest of the work is on us.”   ✔When the payouts start “The payouts begin the first day our farm is launched, and will go on for as long as the profits are higher than electricity costs.”   ✔Plans for the future “Our plans haven’t changed: we want to build a 3 terahash per second farm. We need $15 mil to do that. We’re talking with big investors, and soon we’re launching the second ICO. The first one was more of an introduction, since $2.8 per token covers hardware costs only, all other expenses aside.  We’re still paying for everything in cryptocurrency – the rent, cooling baths, chips, etc. This was the core idea of the project. During this trip to China we managed to reach all the goals that we’d set for it. So far it’s going according to plan.” We would like to remind you that our first ICO is over, and the second one starts in December. Right now you can buy TRM tokens on the EtherDelta exchange, for near ICO prices.

We won’t have to disassemble the miners, which decreases downtime drastically.   ✔ Intermodal containers are robust and durable, and  have been in use for decades all over the world, and a lot of times – for things other than moving cargo. There’s a whole container  city in Mexico, where these boxes make houses, kindergartens, stores, labs, etc. It’s almost a monolith structure that doesn’t need a foundation to stand strong on the ground, and it’s highly mobile by design.   ✔One of the pros of these containers is that they can be stacked, and make a structure of almost any size. Since we’re planning to scale up our project, this is the most convenient solution for us.  Just a couple of weeks left before the launch! Body: Official TerraMiner statement on Sichuan energy company crackdown on miners We deem it necessary to comment on a Sichuan energy company internal document that’s been making rounds on the internet. On November 4, the company ruled its local administrators to cut off power from miners since Bitcoin is illegal. This Caijing article has sparked heated discussions in cryptosphere, namely, on Reddit and Twitter. Does that mean China is imposing a ban on mining and is cutting off power from farms? Let’s preface this with saying that Sichuan energy company, just as any other, has no legal power declaring activities illegal, this is up to the government. @cnLedger on Twitter has already confirmed the company admitting the mistake. They blamed it on rushing, and now assure that they don’t take on the role of the government in deciding whether mining is legal or not. The same account explains that decision with the company’s concern for small and distant villages’ power supply. The point is, six out of nine Sichuan hydro power plants provide power to miners. The company was worried about prioritization issues that would lead to power outages in certain towns and villages, and decided to take measures. Therefore this internal document is no reason to believe that China is imposing a ban on mining. If a major gas station chain decided to stop servicing black cars, would that mean the country outlawed driving black cars? Not in the slightest. Are there grounds for concern to TerraMiner investors and TRM holders? There are none, here’s why: 1. Shaoguan, where the TerraMiner farm is located, is a 20 hours drive from Sichuan. Whatever their energy company decides has no bearing on the local power grid. 2. Shaoguan belongs to a free economic zone, providing more favourable business conditions compared to other regions in the country. Therefore any legal rulings will be adjusted with free economic zones in mind. 3. Even the most pessimistic scenarios don’t include a complete ban on mining. Energy power companies want miners to buy power for market prices instead of reduced rates. One of the largest players in the cryptosphere, Bitmain, are already buying ene rgy for market prices, and their mining revenue still exceeds energy costs. 4. Let’s consider the extreme scenario of an outright ban on mining by the Chinese government, or restrictive measures so tight that mining becomes unprofitable. Dr. Craig Wright, one of the chief scientists at nChain, reminded his Twitter followers that there are 20 more countries out there where energy is even cheaper than in China. In case everything does go south, miners can leave China and get a better deal elsewhere. 5. To conclude, let’s give TerraMiner a closer look. As we said before, Sichuan decisions don’t affect us one way or another. If the Chinese authorities do set out to ban and restrict, the project has a backup plan in Russia, Irkutsk, where electricity is even cheaper than in Shaoguan. When it comes to Russia, judging from the government statements, we can see there is no drive to ban these activities, but regulate. First Deputy Chairman of the Central Bank of Russia, Sergey Shvetsov, has recently commented on the matter, unveiling plans to develop standard legal requirements to mining and ICO, and legally define cryptocurrencies, blockchain and smart-contracts by 1 July 2018. “We must create regulations that won’t smother businesses and at the same time protect investors from obvious scams”, said First Deputy Chairman. We can draw the conclusion that cryptocurrency operations and mining will remain legal in Russia, while tax and registration initiatives will come into the picture no sooner than Q1 next year. We hope this information clarified the issue for concerned investors. Any questions and comments are welcome in our Telegram chat https://t.me/joinchat/EirtT0FmYMoFY7P12HjGhQ

Title: [ANN][ICO]TerraMiner - The First mining farm in which anyone can invest.
Body: A Quick Rundown on Terraminer As you might know, during the ICO, Pavel Kuznetsov, our CEO, held a few webinars answering viewers’ main questions. We decided to gather all the questions and answers in one place and post in on our website so you can always find this information. Don’t get upset if you missed the webinar: you can get a quick rundown here. If you watched the webinars, you can also skim through these posts to refresh the key points in your memory and make sure you got everything right.  When will you finally launch the farm? How many days behind schedule are you? ✔The hardware manufacturer has notified us about delivering on December 15th. Thus, we’re lagging 5 days behind, which is insignificant. I would like to remind you that we’re not buying a ready-made solution — we design our own, higher performance miners.  Why is the launch postponed? Haven’t you raised enough money during the ICO? ✔We have enough money to launch the farm at the stated capacity.  When will we see the first dividends in our wallets? ✔As it was stated earlier, the payouts begin after the farm is launched, late December.  When and why are you going to China? Why have you postponed the trip? ✔On Monday we fly to Shaoguan to sign a lease agreement with the power plant as well as a mineral oil cooling baths installation contract with the respective manufacturers. We already have visas and tickets. The trip was delayed because we were looking for the best candidate to fill the onsite project supervisor position in China. The supervisor has been found, and he’s flying with me to China, where he will stay to control the farm building process and its launch. I will return to Moscow after 10 days.  How many miners will you install? ✔According to the declared hashrate of the farm, we must make 53 miners. However, we will make more — 60 miners, to have about 20% of output as backup. This ensures that even in case of force-majeure, the farm will provide the required output.  Why is the company registered in Bulgaria? ✔I would like to remind you that the original aim of this project was to pay for all the services and equipment in cryptocurrency only, avoiding operations in fiat money and bypassing the banking system. Therefore, a legal entity in Bulgaria was created as a formality, to conclude lease agreements and hardware contracts. We are under the Bulgarian jurisdiction, but all our payments in China are made in cryptocurrency, bypassing the banks.  What guarantees can you provide to investors? ✔Token holders own the hashrate. The hardware manufacturer offers a three year warranty, and this is enough to protect the interests of TRM token holders. With those who invest over $ 10,000, we additionally conclude a pledge agreement. All payment documents with manufacturers and landlords will be released on the website upon my return from China.  When the farm is ready, will anybody be responsible for the safety of the equipment? ✔We conclude a three year lease and register it officially. It means that the landlord will be fully responsible for what is happening on our premises.  What is your plan in case mining and cryptocurrency operations in China are banned? ✔ We have a backup project ready in Irkutsk, Russia. Electricity there is even cheaper than in Shaoguan at just 5 cents per kW. We are ready to launch the Russian project as soon as we hear the official position of the authorities on the issue of cryptocurrency and mining.  How many tokens are planned for issue, and will there be a subsequent offering? ✔I would like to remind you that each token is backed by a fraction a mining farm, 1 token is equal to 1 megahash, therefore their limited number is exactly 104,600. Additional tokens can occur only if the farm gives output, which is more than the planned one.  Why can’t I buy tokens for fiat money? ✔As I’ve already said, the idea of the project was to create a real business with virtual money, and we succeeded. That’s why we do not accept investments in fiat money — only in the cryptocoins.  What are the privileges for those who invest over $ 10,000? ✔Those who invested over $ 10,000 receive a bonus in the form of additional tokens to increase their share in farm hashrate, sold by private subscription.  When will you start redeeming tokens on an exchange? ✔As it was mentioned earlier, we will redeem tokens on an exchange, on 10% of our profits. We will begin after the project launch and its first payouts, namely, sometime in January 2018.  Will it be possible to buy tokens in December? ✔In December, you will only be able to buy tokens off an exchange, if someone from existing investors wants to sell them. Body: Interview with Ogienko Antonina Sergeevna, head of the taxation methodology Department of ForteInvest JSC How do you feel about the cryptocurrency boom, do you consider the blockchain technology and cryptomoney to be an effective financial instrument? I’m wary of any kind of boom. There are always those who blindly rush into any trend, and those who want to make money on a frenzy. However, fortunately, there are always those who embrace trends as an opportunity to to widen the scope, and leverage new possibilities to benefit not only themselves, but also the community. The same is relevant for the cryptoindustry: I trust only those projects that are responsibly approaching the matter. In general, blockchain technology is interesting, as it eliminates intermediaries in transactions and therefore gives people access to financial instruments at a minimum cost. You are an employee of an oil company. Do you think it’s true that oil and other non-renewable energy sources are gradually losing ground? Or vice versa, oil and gas are reliable, unlike digital and crypto, for the latter are not more than just a fashion? For many years I’ve heard rumors that oil and gas will soon become irrelevant. But let’s be honest: most of modern production, transport systems and other spheres of life go with traditional energy sources. Body: Mining: from Mine to a Farm   About 10 years ago the English word "mining" meant exclusively the extraction of minerals mainly in mines. Today, there are few people who relate dull miners or under mining to it's significance being a complex technological process of issuing a certain cryptocurrency.   To facilitate the understanding of the process and get rid of unnecessary terminology, we suggest examining the nuances of mining using the example of one cryptocurrency - Bitcoin. In a broad sense, mining is an issue of cryptocurrency, based on the distributed computing work of users' computers located around the globe. The implementation of mathematical algorithms, or rather the scope of this work, determines the probability of obtaining a reward - units of cryptocurrency, that is, Bitcoin. There is no single control center for this activity, which guarantees its safety. Why this process was called mining? Because at some point Bitcoin was called digital gold. In order to penetrate into the essence of cryptocurrency mining, you need to arm yourself with special knowledge, or at least a minimal understanding of the relevant terminology. What is the work of the miner and why does he get a reward for it?  All the Bitcoin transactions are recorded in a special log, which is then passed on to the miners who, using the capabilities of their own equipment, try to calculate one single hash value that matches the private key and new transactions. As soon as this happens, a new block is generated. The computed hash is the hash of the previous block, and collectively this is called a blockchain (chain of blocks). For the generation of each new block, there is a reward - in fact, a unit of cryptocurrency. Why do cryptocurrencies need miners? At least the miners of the XXI century ensure the stability and efficiency of the entire world cryptocurrency system, since the more people who use Bitcoin, the wider is the decentralization becomes.  The first thing to consider after reading all of the above, is why do I still stay aside from mining? Purely having a computer and a stable broadband connection to the Internet, anyone can replenish the multi-million army of modern miners. However, the effectiveness of solo-mining today, most likely, will tend to zero. The fact is that the distribution of Bitcoin or any other cryptocurrency between the miners directly depends on how many people are engaged in this activity and what aggregate capacities they have. So if in 2009 the extraction of digital currency using the private processor, and then the video card, also guaranteed a stable (and sometimes even high) income, now this activity has almost no sense. For the last 3 to 5 years, entire data centers have grown in all corners of the globe, which the only purpose is Bitcoin mining. The most modern equipment is installed there, the hardware of which (ASIC chips) is optimized for mining. Each data center has tremendous processing power (from 0.1 to 1 - 2 percent of the total computing power of the Bitcoin network). To compete with such monsters makes no sense for ordinary users.  The only possibility to jump onto the departing train is to try to study the cryptocurrencies in second and third place, the amount of calculation of which is still at such a level that a small farm of 3 - 5 - 10 powerful video cards can guarantee a stable inflow of coins. However, you need to understand that the cost of an admission ticket even to this sector is at least 2,000 - 2,500 thousand dollars, not counting the cost of electricity. Plus, no one guarantees that the cryptocurrency, which you have been mining diligently for the past few weeks, will not turn to be a scam within a month.  Another, affordable option - an alternative to regional mining - the purchase of capacity in an operating farm, such as TerraMiner. Today, the launch of one small farm can go up to $ 10,000, in the project TerraMiner buy 1Mh / s capacity can be priced from $ 2.8. The company will take on the solution of such problems as high noise level; expenses for equipment rent; payment of bills for electricity; problems with warranty equipment; constant monitoring of equipment. Further - all the income from the mining is divided between the company and the investor 50/50.  Want to learn more about how to become a $ 2.8 farm owner? Go to the site https://terraminer.online/
